Mahatma Gandhi: How much more then, the pure brahmanas and seer-kings who are my  devotees? Do you worship Me, therefore, since you have come to this fleeting  and joyless world.
Shri Swami Purohit: What need then to mention the holy Ministers of God, the devotees and the saintly rulers? Do you, therefore, born in this changing and miserable world, do you too worship Me.

Eknath Easwaran: Fill your mind with me; love me; serve me; worship me always. Seeking me in your heart, you will at last be united with me.
Mahatma Gandhi: On Me fix your mind, to Me bring your devotion, to Me offer your sacrifice, to  Me make your obeisance; thus having attached yourself to Me and made Me your  end and aim, to Me indeed shall you come.
Shri Swami Purohit: Fix your mind on Me, devote yourself to Me, sacrifice for Me, surrender to Me, make Me the object of your aspirations, and you shall assuredly become one with Me, Who am yours own Self.”

Eknath Easwaran: KRISHNA:  Listen further, Arjuna, to my supreme teaching, which gives you such joy. Desiring your welfare, O strong-armed warrior, I will tell you more.
Mahatma Gandhi: Yet once more, O Arjuna, here My supreme word, which I will utter to  you, gratified one, for your benefit.
Shri Swami Purohit: “Lord Shri Krishna said: Now, O Prince! Listen to My supreme advice, which I give you for the sake of your welfare, for you are My beloved.

Eknath Easwaran: Neither gods nor sages know my origin, for I am the source from which the gods and sages come.
Mahatma Gandhi: Neither the gods nor the great seers know My origin; for I am, every way, the  origin of them both.
Shri Swami Purohit: Neither the professors of divinity nor the great ascetics know My origin, for I am the source of them all.

Eknath Easwaran: Whoever knows me as the Lord of all creation, without birth or beginning, knows the truth and frees himself from all evil.
Mahatma Gandhi: He who knows Me, the great lord of the worlds, as birthless and without  beginning, he among mortals, undeluded, is released from sins.
Shri Swami Purohit: He who knows Me as the unborn, without beginning, the Lord of the universe, he, stripped of his delusion, becomes free from all conceivable sin.

Eknath Easwaran: Discrimination, wisdom, understanding, forgiveness, truth, selfcontrol, and peace of mind; pleasure and pain, birth and death, fear and courage, honor and dishonor;
Mahatma Gandhi: Discernment, knowledge, freedom from delusion, long suffering, truth,  self-restraint, inward calm, pleasure, pain, birth, death, fear and fearlessness;
Shri Swami Purohit: Intelligence, wisdom, non-illusion, forgiveness, truth, self-control, calmness, pleasure, pain, birth, death, fear and fearlessness;

Eknath Easwaran: nonviolence, charity, equanimity, contentment, and perseverance in spiritual disciplines  all the different qualities found in living creatures have their source in me.
Mahatma Gandhi: Non-violence, even-mindedness, contentment, austerity, beneficence, good  and ill fame,—all these various attributes of creatures proceed verily from Me.
Shri Swami Purohit: Harmlessness, equanimity, contentment, austerity, beneficence, fame and failure, all these, the characteristics of beings, spring from Me only.

Eknath Easwaran: The seven great sages and the four ancient ancestors were born from my mind and received my power. From them came all the creatures of this world.
Mahatma Gandhi: The seven great seers, the ancient four, and the Manus too were born of Me  and of My mind, and of them were born all the creatures in the world.
Shri Swami Purohit: The seven Great Seers, the Progenitors of mankind, the Ancient Four, and the Lawgivers were born of My Will and come forth direct from Me. The race of mankind has sprung from them.

Eknath Easwaran: Whoever understands my power and the mystery of my manifestations comes without doubt to be united with me.
Mahatma Gandhi: He who knows in truth My immanence and My yoga becomes gifted with  unshakable yoga; of this there is no doubt.
Shri Swami Purohit: He who rightly understands My manifested glory and My Creative Power, beyond doubt attains perfect peace.

Eknath Easwaran: I am the source from which all creatures evolve. The wise remember this and worship me with loving devotion.
Mahatma Gandhi: I am the source of all, all proceeds from me; knowing this, the wise worship  Me with hearts full of devotion.
Shri Swami Purohit: I am the source of all; from Me everything flows. Therefore the wise worship Me with unchanging devotion.

Eknath Easwaran: Their thoughts are all absorbed in me, and all their vitality flows to me. Teaching one another, talking about me always, they are happy and fulfilled.
Mahatma Gandhi: With me in their thoughts, their whole soul devoted to Me, teaching one  another, with me ever on their lips, they live in contentment and joy.
Shri Swami Purohit: With minds concentrated on Me, with lives absorbed in Me, and enlightening each other, they ever feel content and happy.

Eknath Easwaran: To those steadfast in love and devotion I give spiritual wisdom, so that they may come to me.
Mahatma Gandhi: To these, ever in tune with Me worshipping me with affectionate devotion, I  give the power of selfless action, whereby they come to Me.
Shri Swami Purohit: To those who are always devout and who worship Me with love, I give the power of discrimination, which leads them to Me.

Eknath Easwaran: Out of compassion I destroy the darkness of their ignorance. From within them I light the lamp of wisdom and dispel all darkness from their lives.
Mahatma Gandhi: Out of every compassion for them, I who dwell in their hearts, destroy the  darkness, born of ignorance, with the refulgent lamp of knowledge.  Arjuna Said:
Shri Swami Purohit: By My grace, I live in their hearts; and I dispel the darkness of ignorance by the shining light of wisdom.

Eknath Easwaran: ARJUNA:  You are Brahman supreme, the highest abode, the supreme purifier, the self-luminous, eternal spirit, first among the gods, unborn and infinite.
Mahatma Gandhi: Lord! You are the supreme Brahman, the supreme Abode, the supreme  Purifier! Everlasting Celestial Being, the Primal God, Unborn, All-pervading.
Shri Swami Purohit: Arjuna asked: You are the Supreme Spirit, the Eternal Home, the Holiest of the Holy, the Eternal Divine Self, the Primal God, the Unborn and the Omnipresent.

Eknath Easwaran: The great sages and seers  Narada, Asita, Devala, and Vyasa too  have acclaimed you thus; now you have declared it to me yourself.
Mahatma Gandhi: Thus have all the seers—the divine seer Narada, Asita, Devala,  Vyasa—declared You; and You Yourself do tell me so.
Shri Swami Purohit: So have said the seers and the divine sage Narada; as well as Asita, Devala and Vyasa; and You Yourself also say it.

Eknath Easwaran: Now, O Krishna, I believe that everything you have told me is divine truth. O Lord, neither gods nor demons know your real nature.
Mahatma Gandhi: All that You tell me is true, I know, O Krishna, verily, Lord, neither the  gods nor the demons know Your manifestation.
Shri Swami Purohit: I believe in what You have said, my Lord! For neither the godly not the godless comprehend Your manifestation.

Eknath Easwaran: Indeed, you alone know yourself, O supreme spirit. You are the source of being and the master of every creature, God of gods, the Lord of the universe.
Mahatma Gandhi: Yourself alone You know by Yourself, O Krishna, O Source and  Lord of all beings, God of Gods, O Ruler of the universe.
Shri Swami Purohit: You alone know Yourself, by the power of Your Self; You the Supreme Spirit, the Source and Master of all being, the Lord of Lords, the Ruler of the Universe.

Eknath Easwaran: Tell me all your divine attributes, leaving nothing unsaid. Tell me of the glories with which you fill the cosmos.
Mahatma Gandhi: Indeed You ought to tell me of all Your manifestations, without a  remainder, whereby You do pervade the worlds.
Shri Swami Purohit: Please tell me all about Your glorious manifestations, by means of which You pervade the world.

Eknath Easwaran: Krishna, you are a supreme master of yoga. Tell me how I should meditate to gain constant awareness of you. In what things and in what ways should I meditate on you?
Mahatma Gandhi: O Yogin! constantly meditating on You, how am I to know You? In what  various aspects am I to think of You, O Lord?
Shri Swami Purohit: O Master! How shall I, by constant meditation, know You? My Lord! What are Your various manifestations through which I am to mediate on You?

Eknath Easwaran: O Krishna, you who stir up peoples hearts, tell me in detail your attributes and your powers; I can never tire of hearing your immortal words.
Mahatma Gandhi: Recount to me yet again, in full detail, Your unique power and Your  immanence, O Krishna! For my ears cannot be sated with listening to Your  life-giving words.  The Lord Said:
Shri Swami Purohit: Tell me again, I pray, about the fullness of Your power and Your glory; for I feel that I am never satisfied when I listen to Your immortal words.

Eknath Easwaran: KRISHNA:  All right, Arjuna, I will tell you of my divine powers. I will mention only the most glorious; for there is no end to them.
Mahatma Gandhi: Yea, I will unfold to you, O Arjuna, My divine manifestations,—the  chief only; for there is no limit to their extent.
Shri Swami Purohit: Lord Shri Krishna replied: So be it, My beloved friend! I will unfold to you some of the chief aspects of My glory. Of its full extent there is no end.

Eknath Easwaran: I am the true Self in the heart of every creature, Arjuna, and the beginning, middle, and end of their existence.
Mahatma Gandhi: I am the soul, O Arjuna, seated in the heart of every being; I am the  beginning, the middle and the end of all beings.
Shri Swami Purohit: O Arjuna! I am the Self, seated in the hearts of all beings; I am the beginning and the life, and I am the end of them all.

Eknath Easwaran: Among the shining gods I am Vishnu; of luminaries I am the sun; among the storm gods I am Marichi, and in the night sky I am the moon.
Mahatma Gandhi: Of the Adityas I am Vishnu; of luminaries, the radiant Sun; of Maruts, I am  Marichi; of constellations, the moon.
Shri Swami Purohit: Of all the creative Powers I am the Creator, of luminaries the Sun; the Whirlwind among the winds, and the Moon among planets.

Eknath Easwaran: Among scriptures I am the Sama Veda, and among the lesser gods I am Indra. Among the senses I am the mind, and in living beings I am consciousness.
Mahatma Gandhi: Of the Vedas I am the Sama Veda; of the gods Indra; of the senses I am the  mind; of beings I am the consciousness.
Shri Swami Purohit: Of the Vedas I am the Hymns, I am the Electric Force in the Powers of Nature; of the senses I am the Mind; and I am the Intelligence in all that lives.

Eknath Easwaran: Among the Rudras I am Shankara. Among the spirits of the natural world I am Kubera, god of wealth, and Pavaka, the purifying fire. Among mountains I am Meru.
Mahatma Gandhi: Of Rudras I am Shankara; of Yakshas and Rakshasas Kubera; of Vasus I am  the Fire; of mountains Meru.
Shri Swami Purohit: Among Forces of Vitality I am the life, I am Mammon to the heathen and the godless; I am the Energy in fire, earth, wind, sky, heaven, sun, moon and planets; and among mountains I am the Mount Meru.

Eknath Easwaran: Among priests I am Brihaspati, and among military leaders I am Skanda. Among bodies of water I am the ocean.
Mahatma Gandhi: Of priests, O Arjuna, know Me to be the chief Brihaspati; of army captains I  am Kartikeya; and of waters the ocean.
Shri Swami Purohit: Among the priests, know, O Arjuna, that I am the Apostle Brihaspati; of generals I am Skanda, the Commander-in-Chief, and of waters I am the Ocean.

Eknath Easwaran: Among the great seers I am Bhrigu, and among words, the syllable Om; I am the repetition of the holy name, and among mountains I am the Himalayas.
Mahatma Gandhi: Of the great seers I am Bhrigu; of words I am the one syllable ‘AUM'; of  sacrifices I am the Japa sacrifice; of things immovable, the Himalaya.
Shri Swami Purohit: Of the great seers I am Bhrigu, of words I am Om, of offerings I am the silent prayer, among things immovable I am the Himalayas.

Eknath Easwaran: Among trees I am the ashvattha, the sacred fig; among the gandharvas, the heavenly musicians, I am Chitraratha. Among divine seers I am Narada, and among sages I am Kapila.
Mahatma Gandhi: Of all trees I am Ashvattha; of the divine seers, Narada; of the heavenly  choir I am Chitraratha; of the perfected I am Kapila the ascetic.
Shri Swami Purohit: Of trees I am the sacred Fig-tree, of the Divine Seers Narada, of the heavenly singers I am Chitraratha, their Leader, and of sages I am Kapila.

Eknath Easwaran: I was born from the nectar of immortality as the primordial horse and as Indras noble elephant. Among human beings, I am the king.
Mahatma Gandhi: Of horses, Know Me to be the Uchchaihshravas born with immortality; of mighty  elephants I am Airavata; of men, the monarch.
Shri Swami Purohit: Know that among horses I am Pegasus, the heaven-born; among the lordly elephants I am the White one, and I am the Ruler among men.

Eknath Easwaran: Among weapons I am the thunderbolt. I am Kamadhuk, the cow that fulfills all desires; I am Kandarpa, the power of sex, and Vasuki, the king of snakes.
Mahatma Gandhi: Of weapons, I am Vajra; of cows, Kamadhenu; I am Kandarpa, the god of  generation; of serpants I am Vasuki.
Shri Swami Purohit: I am the Thunderbolt among weapons; of cows I am the Cow of Plenty, I am Passion in those who procreate, and I am the Cobra among serpents.

Eknath Easwaran: I am Ananta, the cosmic serpent, and Varuna, the god of water; I am Aryaman among the noble ancestors. Among the forces which restrain I am Yama, the god of death.
Mahatma Gandhi: Of cobras I am Anata; of water-dwellers I am Varuna; of the manes I am  Aryaman; and of the chastisers, Yama.
Shri Swami Purohit: I am the King-python among snakes, I am the Aqueous Principle among those that live in water, I am the Father of fathers, and among rulers I am Death.

Eknath Easwaran: Among animals I am the lion; among birds, the eagle Garuda. I am Prahlada, born among the demons, and of all that measures, I am time.
Mahatma Gandhi: Of demons I am Prahlada; of reckoners, the time; of beasts I am the lion; and  of birds, Garuda.
Shri Swami Purohit: And I am the devotee Prahlad among the heathen; of Time I am the Eternal Present; I am the Lion among beasts and the Eagle among birds.

Eknath Easwaran: Among purifying forces I am the wind; among warriors, Rama. Of water creatures I am the crocodile, and of rivers I am the Ganges.
Mahatma Gandhi: Of cleansing agents I am the Wind; of wielders of weapons, Rama; of fishes I  am the crocodile; of rivers the Ganges.
Shri Swami Purohit: I am the Wind among purifiers, the King Rama among warriors; I am the Crocodile among the fishes, and I am the Ganges among rivers.

Eknath Easwaran: I am the beginning, middle, and end of creation. Of all the sciences I am the science of Self-knowledge, and I am logic in those who debate.
Mahatma Gandhi: Of creations I am the beginning, end and middle, O Arjuna; of sciences, the  science of spiritual knowledge; of debators, the right argument.
Shri Swami Purohit: I am the Beginning, the Middle and the End in creation; among sciences, I am the science of Spirituality; I am the Discussion among disputants.

Eknath Easwaran: Among letters I am A; among grammatical compounds I am the dvandva. I am infinite time, and the sustainer whose face is seen everywhere.
Mahatma Gandhi: Of letters, the letter A; of compounds I am the dvandva; I am the  imperishable Time; I am the creator to be seen everywhere.
Shri Swami Purohit: Of letters I am A; I am the copulative in compound words; I am Time inexhaustible; and I am the all-pervading Preserver.

Eknath Easwaran: I am death, which overcomes all, and the source of all beings still to be born. I am the feminine qualities: fame, beauty, perfect speech, memory, intelligence, loyalty, and forgiveness.
Mahatma Gandhi: All-seizing Death am I, as the source of things to be; in feminine virtues I am  Kirti (glory), Shri (beauty), Vak (speech), Smriti (memory), Medha  (intelligence), Dhriti (constancy) and Kshama (forgiveness).
Shri Swami Purohit: I am all-devouring Death; I am the Origin of all that shall happen; I am Fame, Fortune, Speech, Memory, Intellect, Constancy and Forgiveness.

Eknath Easwaran: Among the hymns of the Sama Veda I am the Brihat; among poetic meters, the Gayatri. Among months I am Margashirsha, first of the year; among seasons I am spring, that brings forth flowers.
Mahatma Gandhi: Of Saman hymns I am Brihat Saman; of metres, Gayatri; of months I am  Margashirsha; of seasons, the spring.
Shri Swami Purohit: Of hymns I am Brihatsama, of metres I am Garatri, among the months I am Margasheersha (December), and I am the Spring among seasons.

Eknath Easwaran: I am the gambling of the gambler and the radiance in all that shines. I am effort, I am victory, and I am the goodness of the virtuous.
Mahatma Gandhi: Of deceivers I am the dice-play; of the splendid the splendour; I am victory,  I am resolution, I am the goodness of the good.
Shri Swami Purohit: I am the Gambling of the cheat and the Splendour of the splendid; I am Victory; I am Effort; and I am the Purity of the pure.

Eknath Easwaran: Among the Vrishnis I am Krishna, and among the Pandavas I am Arjuna. Among sages I am Vyasa, and among poets, Ushanas.
Mahatma Gandhi: Of Vrishnis I am Krishna; of Pandavas Arjuna; of ascetics I am Vyasa;  and of seers, Ushanas.
Shri Swami Purohit: I am Shri Krishna among the Vishnu-clan and Arjuna among the Pandavas; of the saints I am Vyasa, and I am Shukracharya among the sages.

Eknath Easwaran: I am the scepter which metes out punishment, and the art of statesmanship in those who lead. I am the silence of the unknown and the wisdom of the wise.
Mahatma Gandhi: I am the rod of those that punish; the strategy of those seeking victory; of  secret things I am silence, and the knowledge of those that know.
Shri Swami Purohit: I am the Sceptre of rulers, the Strategy of the conquerors, the Silence of mystery, the Wisdom of the wise.

Eknath Easwaran: I am the seed that can be found in every creature, Arjuna; for without me nothing can exist, neither animate nor inanimate.
Mahatma Gandhi: Whatever is the seed of every being, O Arjuna, that am I; there is nothing,  whether moving or fixed, that can be without Me.
Shri Swami Purohit: I am the Seed of all being, O Arjuna! No creature moving or unmoving can live without Me.

Eknath Easwaran: But there is no end to my divine attributes, Arjuna; these I have mentioned are only a few.
Mahatma Gandhi: there is no end to my divine manifestations; what extent of them I have told  you now is only by way of illustration.
Shri Swami Purohit: O Arjuna! The aspects of My divine life are endless. I have mentioned but a few by way of illustration.

Eknath Easwaran: Wherever you find strength, or beauty, or spiritual power, you may be sure that these have sprung from a spark of my essence.
Mahatma Gandhi: Whatever is glorious, beautiful and mighty know you that all such has  issued from a fragment of My splendour.
Shri Swami Purohit: Whatever is glorious, excellent, beautiful and mighty, be assured that it comes from a fragment of My splendour.

Eknath Easwaran: But of what use is it to you to know all this, Arjuna? Just remember that I am, and that I support the entire cosmos with only a fragment of my being.
Mahatma Gandhi: But why need you to learn this at great length, O Arjuna? With but a  part of Myself I stand upholding this universe.
Shri Swami Purohit: But what is the use of all these details to you? O Arjuna! I sustain this universe with only small part of Myself.”

Eknath Easwaran: ARJUNA:  Out of compassion you have taught me the supreme mystery of the Self. Through your words my delusion is gone.
Mahatma Gandhi: Out of Your grace towards me, you have told me the supreme mystery  revealing the knowledge of the Supreme; it has banished my delusion.
Shri Swami Purohit: “Arjuna said: My Lord! Your words concerning the Supreme Secret of Self, given for my blessing, have dispelled the illusions which surrounded me.

Eknath Easwaran: You have explained the origin and end of every creature, O lotus-eyed one, and told me of your own supreme, limitless existence.
Mahatma Gandhi: Of the origin and destruction of beings I have heard from You in full detail,  as also Your imperishable ajesty [sic], O Kamala-patraksha!
Shri Swami Purohit: O Lord, whose eyes are like the lotus petal! You have described in detail the origin and the dissolution of being, and Yours own Eternal Majesty.

Eknath Easwaran: Just as you have described your infinite glory, O Lord, now I long to see it. I want to see you as the supreme ruler of creation.
Mahatma Gandhi: You are indeed as You have described Yourself, Supreme lord! I do crave to  behold, now, that form of Yours as Supreme Being.
Shri Swami Purohit: I believe all as You have declared it. I long now to have a vision of your Divine Form, O You Most High!

Eknath Easwaran: O Lord, master of yoga, if you think me strong enough to behold it, show me your immortal Self.
Mahatma Gandhi: If, Lord, you thinks it possible for me to bear the sight, reveal to me, O  Krishna, Your imperishable form.  The Lord Said:
Shri Swami Purohit: If You think that it can be made possible for me to see it, show me, O Lord of Lords, Yours own Eternal Self.

Eknath Easwaran: KRISHNA:  Behold, Arjuna, a million divine forms, with an infinite variety of color and shape.
Mahatma Gandhi: Behold, O Arjuna, my forms divine in their hundreds and thousands,  infinitely diverse, infinitely various in color and aspect.
Shri Swami Purohit: Lord Shri Krishna replied: Behold, O Arjuna! My celestial forms, by hundred and thousands, various in kind, in colour and in shape.

Eknath Easwaran: Behold the gods of the natural world, and many more wonders never revealed before.
Mahatma Gandhi: Behold the Adityas, the Vasus, the Rudras, the two Ashwins, the Maruts;  behold, O Arjuna, numerous marvels never revealed before.
Shri Swami Purohit: Behold you the Powers of Nature: fire, earth, wind and sky; the sun, the heavens, the moon, the stars; all forces of vitality and of healing; and the roving winds. See the myriad wonders revealed to none but you.

Eknath Easwaran: Behold the entire cosmos turning within my body, and the other things you desire to see.
Mahatma Gandhi: Behold today, O Arjuna, in my body, the whole universe, moving and  unmoving, all in one, and whatever else you craves to see.
Shri Swami Purohit: Here in Me living as one, O Arjuna, behold the whole universe, movable and immovable, and anything else that you would see!

Eknath Easwaran: But these things cannot be seen with your physical eyes; therefore I give you spiritual vision to perceive my majestic power.
Mahatma Gandhi: But you can not see Me with these yours own eyes. I give you the eye  divine; behold My sovereign power!  Sanjaya Said:
Shri Swami Purohit: Yet since with mortal eyes you can not see Me, lo! I give you the Divine Sight. See now the glory of My Sovereignty.”

Eknath Easwaran: SANJAYA:  Having spoken these words, Krishna, the master of yoga, revealed to Arjuna his most exalted, lordly form.
Mahatma Gandhi: With these words, O King, the great Lord of Yoga, Krishna, then revealed to  Arjuna His supreme form as Supreme Being.
Shri Swami Purohit: Sanjaya continued: “Having thus spoken, O King, the Lord Shri Krishna, the Almighty Prince of Wisdom, showed to Arjuna the Supreme Form of the Great God.

Eknath Easwaran: He appeared with an infinite number of faces, ornamented by heavenly jewels, displaying unending miracles and the countless weapons of his power.
Mahatma Gandhi: With many mouths and many eyes, many wondrous aspects, many divine  ornaments, and many brandished weapons divine.
Shri Swami Purohit: There were countless eyes and mouths, and mystic forms innumerable, with shining ornaments and flaming celestial weapons.

Eknath Easwaran: Clothed in celestial garments and covered with garlands, sweet-smelling with heavenly fragrances, he showed himself as the infinite Lord, the source of all wonders, whose face is everywhere.
Mahatma Gandhi: Wearing divine garlands and vestments, annointed with divine perfumes, it  was the form of God, all-marvellous [sic], infinite, seen everywhere.
Shri Swami Purohit: Crowned with heavenly garlands, clothed in shining garments, anointed with divine unctions, He showed Himself as the Resplendent One, Marvellous, Boundless, Omnipresent.

Eknath Easwaran: If a thousand suns were to rise in the heavens at the same time, the blaze of their light would resemble the splendor of that supreme spirit.
Mahatma Gandhi: Were the splendour of a thousand suns to shoot forth all at once in the sky  that might perchance resemble the splendour of that Mighty One.
Shri Swami Purohit: Could a thousand suns blaze forth together it would be but a faint reflection of the radiance of the Lord God.

Eknath Easwaran: There, within the body of the God of gods, Arjuna saw all the manifold forms of the universe united as one.
Mahatma Gandhi: Then did Arjuna see the whole universe in its manifold divisions gathered  as one in the body of that God of gods.
Shri Swami Purohit: In that vision Arjuna saw the universe, with its manifold shapes, all embraced in One, its Supreme Lord.

Eknath Easwaran: Filled with amazement, his hair standing on end in ecstasy, he bowed before the Lord with joined palms and spoke these words.
Mahatma Gandhi: Then Arjuna, wonderstruck and thrilled in every fibre of his being,  bowed low his head before the Lord, addressing Him thus with folded hands.  Arjuna Said:
Shri Swami Purohit: Thereupon Arjuna, dumb with awe, his hair on end, his head bowed, his hands clasped in salutation, addressed the Lord thus:

Eknath Easwaran: ARJUNA  O Lord, I see within your body all the gods and every kind of living creature. I see Brahma, the Creator, seated on a lotus; I see the ancient sages and the celestial serpents.
Mahatma Gandhi: With Your form, O Lord, I see all the gods and the diverse multitudes of  beings, the Lord Brahma, on his lotus-throne and all the seers and serpents  divine.
Shri Swami Purohit: Arjuna said: O almighty God! I see in You the powers of Nature, the various creatures of the world, the Progenitor on his lotus throne, the Sages and the shining angels.

Eknath Easwaran: I see infinite mouths and arms, stomachs and eyes, and you are embodied in every form. I see you everywhere, without beginning, middle, or end. You are the Lord of all creation, and the cosmos is your body.
Mahatma Gandhi: With many arms and bellies, mouths and eyes, I see Your infinite form  everywhere. Neither Your end, nor middle, nor beginning, do I see, O Lord of  the Universe, Universal-formed!
Shri Swami Purohit: I see You, infinite in form, with, as it were, faces, eyes and limbs everywhere; no beginning, no middle, no end; O You Lord of the Universe, Whose Form is universal!

Eknath Easwaran: You wear a crown and carry a mace and discus; your radiance is blinding and immeasurable. I see you, who are so difficult to behold, shining like a fiery sun blazing in every direction.
Mahatma Gandhi: With crown and mace and disc, a mass of effulgence, gleaming everywhere I  see You, so dazzling to the sight, bright with the splendour of the fiery sun  blazing from all sides,—incomprehensible.
Shri Swami Purohit: I see you with the crown, the sceptre and the discus; a blaze of splendour. Scarce can I gaze on you, so radiant you are, glowing like the blazing fire, brilliant as the sun, immeasurable.

Eknath Easwaran: You are the supreme, changeless Reality, the one thing to be known. You are the refuge of all creation, the immortal spirit, the eternal guardian of eternal dharma.
Mahatma Gandhi: You are the Supreme Imperishable worthy to be known; You are the final  resting place of this universe; You are the changeless guardian of the Eternal  Dharma; You are, I believe, the Everlasting Being.
Shri Swami Purohit: Imperishable are You, the Sole One worthy to be known, the priceless Treasure-house of the universe, the immortal Guardian of the Life Eternal, the Spirit Everlasting.

Eknath Easwaran: You are without beginning, middle, or end; you touch everything with your infinite power. The sun and moon are your eyes, and your mouth is fire; your radiance warms the cosmos.
Mahatma Gandhi: You have no beginning, middle nor end; infinite is Your might; arms  innumerable; for eyes, the sun and the moon; Your mouth a blazing fire,  overpowering the universe with Your radiance.
Shri Swami Purohit: Without beginning, without middle and without end, infinite in power, Yours arms allembracing, the sun and moon Yours eyes, Your face beaming with the fire of sacrifice, flooding the whole universe with light.

Eknath Easwaran: O Lord, your presence fills the heavens and the earth and reaches in every direction. I see the three worlds trembling before this vision of your wonderful and terrible form.
Mahatma Gandhi: By You alone are filled the spaces between heaven and earth and all the  quarters; at the sight of this Your wondrous terrible form, the three worlds are  sore oppressed, O great-souled!
Shri Swami Purohit: Alone you fill all the quarters of the sky, earth and heaven, and the regions between. O Almighty Lord! Seeing Your marvellous and awe-inspiring Form, the spheres tremble with fear.

Eknath Easwaran: The gods enter your being, some calling out and greeting you in fear. Great saints sing your glory, praying, May all be well!
Mahatma Gandhi: Here, too, the multitudes of gods are seen to enter You; some awe-struck  praise You with folded arms; the hosts of great seers and siddhas, ‘All Hail' on  their lips, hymn You with songs of praise.
Shri Swami Purohit: The troops of celestial beings enter into You, some invoking You in fear, with folded palms; the Great Seers and Adepts sing hymns to Your Glory, saying `All Hail.’

Eknath Easwaran: The multitudes of gods, demigods, and demons are all overwhelmed by the sight of you.
Mahatma Gandhi: The Rudras, Adityas, Vasus, Sadhyas, all the gods, the twin Ashwins,  Maruts, Manes, the hosts of Gandharvas, Yakshas, Asuras and Siddhas—all  gaze on You in wonderment.
Shri Swami Purohit: The Vital Forces, the Major stars, Fire, Earth, Air, Sky, Sun, Heaven, Moon and Planets; the Angels, the Guardians of the Universe, the divine Healers, the Winds, the Fathers, the Heavenly Singers; and hosts of Mammon-worshippers, demons as well as saints, are amazed.

Eknath Easwaran: O mighty Lord, at the sight of your myriad eyes and mouths, arms and legs, stomachs and fearful teeth, I and the entire universe shake in terror.
Mahatma Gandhi: At the sight of your mighty form, O Arjuna, many-mouthed, with eyes,  arms, thighs and feet innumerable, with many vast bellies, terrible with many  jaws, the worlds feel fearfully oppressed, and so do I.
Shri Swami Purohit: Seeing Your stupendous Form, O Most Mighty, with its myriad faces, its innumerable eyes and limbs and terrible jaws, I myself and all the worlds are overwhelmed with awe.

Eknath Easwaran: O Vishnu, I can see your eyes shining; with open mouth, you glitter in an array of colors, and your body touches the sky. I look at you and my heart trembles; I have lost all courage and all peace of mind.
Mahatma Gandhi: For as I behold You touching the sky, glowing, numerous-hued with  gaping mouths and wide resplendent eyes, I feel oppressed in my innermost  being; no peace nor quiet I find, O Vishnu!
Shri Swami Purohit: When I see You, touching the Heavens, glowing with colour, with open mouth and wide open fiery eyes, I am terrified. O My Lord! My courage and peace of mind desert me.

Eknath Easwaran: When I see your mouths with their fearful teeth, mouths burning like the fires at the end of time, I forget where I am and I have no place to go. O Lord, you are the support of the universe; have mercy on me!
Mahatma Gandhi: As I see Your mouths with fearful jaws, resembling the Fire of Doom, I lose  all sense of direction, and find no relief. Be gracious, O Krishna, O Krishna!
Shri Swami Purohit: When I see Your mouths with their fearful jaws like glowing fires at the dissolution of creation, I lose all sense of place; I find no rest. Be merciful, O Lord in whom this universe abides!

Eknath Easwaran: I see all the sons of Dhritarashtra; I see Bhishma, Drona, and Karna; I see our warriors and all the kings who are here to fight.
Mahatma Gandhi: All the sons of Dhritarashtra, and with them the crowd of kings, Bhishma,  Drona, and that Karna too, as also our chief warriors—
Shri Swami Purohit: All these sons of Dhritarashtra, with the hosts of princes, Bheeshma, Drona and Karna, as well as the other warrior chiefs belonging to our side;

Eknath Easwaran: All are rushing into your awful jaws; I see some of them crushed by your teeth.
Mahatma Gandhi: Are hastening into the fearful jaws of Your terrible mouths. Some indeed,  caught between Your teeth, are seen, their heads being crushed to atoms.
Shri Swami Purohit: I see them all rushing headlong into Your mouths, with terrible tusks, horrible to behold. Some are mangled between your jaws, with their heads crushed to atoms.

Eknath Easwaran: As rivers flow into the ocean, all the warriors of this world are passing into your fiery jaws;
Mahatma Gandhi: As rivers, in their numerous torrents, run head-long to the sea, even so the  heroes of the world of men rush into Your flaming mouths.
Shri Swami Purohit: As rivers in flood surge furiously to the ocean, so these heroes, the greatest among men, fling themselves into Your flaming mouths.

Eknath Easwaran: all creatures rush to their destruction like moths into a flame.
Mahatma Gandhi: As moths, fast-flying, plunge into blazing fire, straight to their doom, even  so these rush headlong into Your mouths, to their destruction.
Shri Swami Purohit: As moths fly impetuously to the flame only to be killed, so these men rush into Your mouths to court their own destruction.

Eknath Easwaran: You lap the worlds into your burning mouths and swallow them. Filled with your terrible radiance, O Vishnu, the whole of creation bursts into flames.
Mahatma Gandhi: Devouring all these from all sides, You laps them with Your flaming  tongues; Your fierce rays blaze forth, filling the whole universe with their lustre.
Shri Swami Purohit: You seem to swallow up the worlds, to lap them in flame. Your glory fills the universe. Your fierce rays beat down upon it irresistibly.

Eknath Easwaran: Tell me who you are, O Lord of terrible form. I bow before you; have mercy! I want to know who you are, you who existed before all creation. Your nature and workings confound me.
Mahatma Gandhi: Tell me, Lord, who You are so dread of form! Hail to You, O Krishna! Be  gracious! I desire to know You, Primal Lord; for I comprehend not what You  do.  The Lord Said:
Shri Swami Purohit: Tell me then who You are, that wear this dreadful Form? I bow before You, O Mighty One! Have mercy, I pray, and let me see You as You were at first. I do not know what You intend.

Eknath Easwaran: KRISHNA:  I am time, the destroyer of all; I have come to consume the world. Even without your participation, all the warriors gathered here will die.
Mahatma Gandhi: Doom am I, full-ripe, dealing death to the worlds, engaged in devouring  mankind. Even without slaying them not one of the warriors, ranged for battle  against you, shall survive.
Shri Swami Purohit: Lord Shri Krishna replied: I have shown myself to you as the Destroyer who lays waste the world and whose purpose is destruction. In spite of your efforts, all these warriors gathered for battle shall not escape death.

Eknath Easwaran: Therefore arise, Arjuna; conquer your enemies and enjoy the glory of sovereignty. I have already slain all these warriors; you will only be my instrument.
Mahatma Gandhi: Therefore, do you arise, and win renown! Defeat your foes and enjoy a  thriving kingdom. By Me have these already been destroyed; be you no more  than an instrument, O Arjuna!
Shri Swami Purohit: Then gird up your loins and conquer. Subdue your foes and enjoy the kingdom in prosperity. I have already doomed them. Be you my instrument, Arjuna!

Eknath Easwaran: Bhishma, Drona, Jayadratha, Karna, and many others are already slain. Kill those whom I have killed. Do not hesitate. Fight in this battle and you will conquer your enemies.
Mahatma Gandhi: Drona, Bhishma, Jayadratha and Karna, as also the other warrior  chiefs—already slain by Me—slay you! Fight! Victory is yours over the foes in  the field.  Sanjaya Said:
Shri Swami Purohit: Drona and Bheeshma, Jayadratha and Karna, and other brave warriors – I have condemned them all. Destroy them; fight and fear not. Your foes shall be crushed.”

Eknath Easwaran: SANJAYA:  Having heard these words, Arjuna trembled in fear. With joined palms he bowed before Krishna and addressed him stammering.
Mahatma Gandhi: Hearing this world of Krishna, crown-wearer Arjuna folded his hands, and  trembling made obeisance. Bowing and all hesitant, in faltering accents, he  proceeded to address Krishna once more.  Arjuna Said:
Shri Swami Purohit: Sanjaya continued: “Having heard these words from the Lord Shri Krishna, the Prince Arjuna, with folded hands trembling, prostrated himself and with choking voice, bowing down again and again, and overwhelmed with awe, once more addressed the Lord.

Eknath Easwaran: ARJUNA:  O Krishna, it is right that the world delights and rejoices in your praise, that all the saints and sages bow down to you and all evil flees before you to the far corners of the universe.
Mahatma Gandhi: Right proper it is, O Krishna, that Your praise should stir the world to  gladness and tender emotion; the Rakshasas in fear fly to every quarter and all  the hosts of Siddhas do reverent homage.
Shri Swami Purohit: Arjuna said: My Lord! It is natural that the world revels and rejoices when it sings the praises of Your glory; the demons fly in fear and the saints offer You their salutations.

Eknath Easwaran: How could they not worship you, O Lord? You are the eternal spirit, who existed before Brahma the Creator and who will never cease to be. Lord of the gods, you are the abode of the universe. Changeless, you are what is and what is not, and beyond the duality of existence and nonexistence.
Mahatma Gandhi: And why should they not bow down to You, O great soul? You are the  First Creator, greater even than Brahma. O the endless one, O Krishna, O Krishna,  You are the Imperishable, Being, not-Being, and That which transcends even  these.
Shri Swami Purohit: How should they do otherwise? O You Most Supreme Self, greater than the Powers of creation, the First Cause, Infinite, the Lord of Lords, the Home of the universe, Imperishable, Being and Not-Being, yet transcending both.

Eknath Easwaran: You are the first among the gods, the timeless spirit, the resting place of all beings. You are the knower and the thing which is known. You are the final home; with your infinite form you pervade the cosmos.
Mahatma Gandhi: You are the Primal God, the Ancient Being; You are the Final Resting Place  of this Universe; You are the Knower, the ‘to-be-known', the Supreme Abode;  by You, O Myriad-formed, is the universe pervaded.
Shri Swami Purohit: You are the Primal God, the Ancient, the Supreme Abode of this universe, the Knower, the Knowledge and the Final Home. You fill everything. Your form is infinite.

Eknath Easwaran: You are Vayu, god of wind; Yama, god of death; Agni, god of fire; Varuna, god of water. You are the moon and the creator Prajapati, and the great-grandfather of all creatures. I bow before you and salute you again and again.
Mahatma Gandhi: You are Vayu, Yama, Agni, Varuna, Shashanka, Prajapati, and  Prapitamaha! All Hail to You, a thousand times all hail! Again and yet again all  hail to You!
Shri Swami Purohit: You are the Wind, You are Death, You are the Fire, the Water, the Moon, the Father and the Grandfather. Honour and glory to You a thousand and a thousand times! Again and again, salutation be to You, O my Lord!

Eknath Easwaran: You are behind me and in front of me; I bow to you on every side. Your power is immeasurable. You pervade everything; you are everything.
Mahatma Gandhi: All hail to You from before and behind! all hail to You from every side, O  All; Your prowess is infinite, Your might is measureless! You hold all;  therefore You are all.
Shri Swami Purohit: Salutations to You in front and on every side, You who encompasseth me round about. Your power is infinite; Your majesty immeasurable; you uphold all things; yea,Thou Yourself are All.

Eknath Easwaran: Sometimes, because we were friends, I rashly said, Oh, Krishna! Say, friend!  casual, careless remarks. Whatever I may have said lightly, whether we were playing or resting, alone or in company, sitting together or eating,
Mahatma Gandhi: If ever in carelessness, thinking of You as comrade, I addressed You  saying, ‘O Krishna!', ‘O Yadava!' not knowing Your greatness, in negligence or in  affection,
Shri Swami Purohit: Whatever I have said unto You in rashness, taking You only for a friend and addressing You as `O Krishna! O Yadava! O Friend!’ in thoughtless familiarity, no understanding Your greatness;

Eknath Easwaran: if it was disrespectful, forgive me for it, O Krishna. I did not know the greatness of your nature, unchanging and imperishable.
Mahatma Gandhi: If ever I have been rude to You in jest, whilst at play, at rest-time, or at  meals, whilst alone or in company, O Krishna, forgive You my fault—I beg of  You, O Incomprehensible!
Shri Swami Purohit: Whatever insult I have offered to You in jest, in sport or in repose, in conversation or at the banquet, alone or in a multitude, I ask Your forgiveness for them all, O You Who are without an equal!

Eknath Easwaran: You are the father of the universe, of the animate and the inanimate; you are the object of all worship, the greatest guru. There is none to equal you in the three worlds. Who can match your power?
Mahatma Gandhi: You are Father of this world, of the moving and the un-moving; you are its  adored, its worthiest, Master; there is none equal to You; how then any greater  than You? Your power is matchless in the three worlds.
Shri Swami Purohit: For You are the Father of all things movable and immovable, the Worshipful, the Master of Masters! In all the worlds there is none equal to You, how then superior, O You who stand alone, Supreme.

Eknath Easwaran: O gracious Lord, I prostrate myself before you and ask for your blessing. As a father forgives his son, or a friend a friend, or a lover his beloved, so should you forgive me.
Mahatma Gandhi: Therefore, I prostrate myself before You, and beseech Your grace, O Lord  adorable! As father with son, as comrade with comrade, so should You bear,  beloved Lord, with me, Your loved one.
Shri Swami Purohit: Therefore I prostrate myself before You, O Lord! Most Adorable! I salute You, I ask Your blessing. Only You can be trusted to bear with me, as father to son, as friend to friend, as lover to his beloved.

Eknath Easwaran: I rejoice in seeing you as you have never been seen before, yet I am filled with fear by this vision of you as the abode of the universe. Please let me see you again as the shining God of gods.
Mahatma Gandhi: I am filled with joy to see what never was seen before, and yet my heart is  oppressed with fear. Show me that original form of Yours, O Lord! Be gracious,  Krishna, O Krishna!
Shri Swami Purohit: I rejoice that I have seen what never man saw before; yet, O Lord! I am overwhelmed with fear. Please take again the Form I know. Be merciful, O Lord! you Who are the Home of the whole universe.

Eknath Easwaran: Though you are the embodiment of all creation, let me see you again not with a thousand arms but with four, carrying the mace and discus and wearing a crown.
Mahatma Gandhi: I crave to see You even as You were, with crown, with mace, and disc in  hand; wear You, once more, that four-armed form, O thousand-armed  Krishna!  The Lord Said:
Shri Swami Purohit: I long to see You as you were before, with the crown, the sceptre and the discus in Your hands; in Your other Form, with Your four hands, O You Whose arms are countless and Whose forms are infinite.

Eknath Easwaran: KRISHNA:  Arjuna, through my grace you have been united with me and received this vision of my radiant, universal form, without beginning or end, which no one else has ever seen.
Mahatma Gandhi: It is to favour you, O Arjuna, that I have revealed to you, by My own  unique power, this My form Supreme, Resplendent, Universal, Infinite,  Primal—which none save you has ever seen.
Shri Swami Purohit: Lord Shri Krishna replied: My beloved friend! It is only through My grace and power that you have been able to see this vision of splendour, the Universal, the Infinite, the Original. Never has it been seen by any but you.

Eknath Easwaran: Not by knowledge of the Vedas, nor sacrifice, nor charity, nor rituals, nor even by severe asceticism has any other mortal seen what you have seen, O heroic Arjuna.
Mahatma Gandhi: Not by the study of the Vedas, not by sacrifice, not by the study of other  scriptures, not by gifts, nor yet by performance of rites or of fierce austerities  can I, in such a form, be seen by any one save you in the world of men, O  Arjuna!
Shri Swami Purohit: Not by study of the scriptures, not by sacrifice or gift, not by ritual or rigorous austerity, is it possible for man on earth to see what you have seen, O you foremost hero of the Kuruclan!

Eknath Easwaran: Do not be troubled; do not fear my terrible form. Let your heart be satisfied and your fears dispelled in looking at me as I was before.
Mahatma Gandhi: Be you neither oppressed nor bewildered to look on this awful form of  Mine. Banish your fear, ease your mind, and lo! behold Me once again as I was.  Sanjaya Said.
Shri Swami Purohit: Be not afraid or bewildered by the terrible vision. Put away your fear and, with joyful mind, see Me once again in My usual Form.”

Eknath Easwaran: SANJAYA:  Having spoken these words, the Lord once again assumed the gentle form of Krishna and consoled his devotee, who had been so afraid.
Mahatma Gandhi: So said Krishna to Arjuna, and revealed to him once more His original  form. Wearing again His form benign, the great soul consoled him terrified.  Arjuna Said.
Shri Swami Purohit: Sanjaya continued: “Having thus spoken to Arjuna, Lord Shri Krishna showed Himself again in His accustomed form; and the Mighty Lord, in gentle tones, softly consoled him who lately trembled with fear.

Eknath Easwaran: ARJUNA:  O Krishna, now that I have seen your gentle human form my mind is again composed and returned to normal.
Mahatma Gandhi: Beholding again your benign human form I am come to myself and once  more in my normal state.  The Lord Said:
Shri Swami Purohit: Arjuna said: Seeing You in Your gentle human form, my Lord, I am myself again, calm once more.

Eknath Easwaran: KRISHNA:  It is extremely difficult to obtain the vision you have had; even the gods long always to see me in this aspect.
Mahatma Gandhi: Very hard to behold is that form of Mine which you have seen; even the  gods always yearn to see it.
Shri Swami Purohit: Lord Shri Krishna replied: It is hard to see this vision of Me that you have seen. Even the most powerful have longed for it in vain.

Eknath Easwaran: Neither knowledge of the Vedas, nor austerity, nor charity, nor sacrifice can bring the vision you have seen.
Mahatma Gandhi: Not by the Vedas, not by penance, nor by gifts, nor yet by sacrifice, can any  behold Me in the form that you have seen.
Shri Swami Purohit: Not by study of the scriptures, or by austerities, not by gifts or sacrifices, is it possible to see Me as you have done.

Eknath Easwaran: But through unfailing devotion, Arjuna, you can know me, see me, and attain union with me.
Mahatma Gandhi: But by single-minded devotion, O Arjuna, I may in this form be known and  seen, and truly entered into, O Arjuna!
Shri Swami Purohit: Only by tireless devotion can I be seen and known; only thus can a man become one with Me, O Arjuna!

Eknath Easwaran: Those who make me the supreme goal of all their work and act without selfish attachment, who devote themselves to me completely and are free from ill will for any creature, enter into me.
Mahatma Gandhi: He alone comes to me, O Arjuna, who does My work, who has made Me  his goal, who is My devotee, who has renounced attachment, who has ill-will  toward none.
Shri Swami Purohit: He whose every action is done for My sake, to whom I am the final goal, who loves Me only and hates no one – O My dearest son, only he can realize Me!”

Eknath Easwaran: ARJUNA  Of those steadfast devotees who love you and those who seek you as the eternal formless Reality, who are the more established in yoga?
Mahatma Gandhi: Of the devotees who thus worship You, incessantly attached, and those who  worship the Imperishable Unmanifest, which are the better yogins?  The Lord Said:
Shri Swami Purohit: “Arjuna asked: My Lord! Which are the better devotees who worship You, those who try to know You as a Personal God, or those who worship You as Impersonal and Indestructible?

Eknath Easwaran: KRISHNA:  Those who set their hearts on me and worship me with unfailing devotion and faith are more established in yoga.
Mahatma Gandhi: Those I regard as the best yogins who, riveting their minds on Me, ever  attached, worship Me, with the highest faith.
Shri Swami Purohit: Lord Shri Krishna replied: Those who keep their minds fixed on Me, who worship Me always with unwavering faith and concentration; these are the very best.

Eknath Easwaran: As for those who seek the transcendental Reality, without name, without form, contemplating the Unmanifested, beyond the reach of thought and of feeling,
Mahatma Gandhi: But those who worship the Imperishable, the indefinable, the Unmanifest, the  Omnipresent, the Unthinkable, the Rock-seated, the Immovable, the  Unchanging,
Shri Swami Purohit: Those who worship Me as the Indestructible, the Undefinable, the Omnipresent, the Unthinkable, the Primeval, the Immutable and the Eternal;

Eknath Easwaran: with their senses subdued and mind serene and striving for the good of all beings, they too will verily come unto me.
Mahatma Gandhi: Keeping the whole host of senses in complete control, looking on all with an  impartial eye, engrossed in the welfare of all beings—these come indeed to Me.
Shri Swami Purohit: Subduing their senses, viewing all conditions of life with the same eye, and working for the welfare of all beings, assuredly they come to Me.

Eknath Easwaran: Yet hazardous and slow is the path to the Unrevealed, difficult for physical creatures to tread.
Mahatma Gandhi: Greater is the travail of those whose mind is fixed on the Unmanifest; for it is  hard for embodied mortals to gain the Unmanifest—Goal.
Shri Swami Purohit: But they who thus fix their attention on the Absolute and Impersonal encounter greater hardships, for it is difficult for those who possess a body to realise Me as without one.

Eknath Easwaran: But they for whom I am the supreme goal, who do all work renouncing self for me and meditate on me with single-hearted devotion,
Mahatma Gandhi: But those who casting all their actions on Me, making Me their all in all,  worship Me with the meditation of undivided devotion,
Shri Swami Purohit: Verily, those who surrender their actions to Me, who muse on Me, worship Me and meditate on Me alone, with no thought save of Me,

Eknath Easwaran: these I will swiftly rescue from the fragments cycle of birth and death, for their consciousness has entered into me.
Mahatma Gandhi: Of such, whose thoughts are centered on Me, O Arjuna, I become before long the  Deliverer from the ocean of this world of death.
Shri Swami Purohit: O Arjuna! I rescue them from the ocean of life and death, for their minds are fixed on Me.

Eknath Easwaran: Still your mind in me, still your intellect in me, and without doubt you will be united with me forever.
Mahatma Gandhi: On Me set your mind, on Me rest your conviction; thus without doubt shall you  remain only in Me hereafter.
Shri Swami Purohit: Then let your mind cling only to Me, let your intellect abide in Me; and without doubt you shall live hereafter in Me alone.

Eknath Easwaran: If you cannot still your mind in me, learn to do so through the regular practice of meditation.
Mahatma Gandhi: If you can not set your mind steadily on Me, then by the method of constant  practice seek to win Me, O Arjuna.
Shri Swami Purohit: But if you can not fix your mind firmly on Me, then, My beloved friend, try to do so by constant practice.

Eknath Easwaran: If you lack the will for such self-discipline, engage yourself in my work, for selfless service can lead you at last to complete fulfillment.
Mahatma Gandhi: If you are also unequal to this method of constant practice, concentrate on  service for Me; even thus serving Me you shall attain perfection.
Shri Swami Purohit: And if you are not strong enough to practise concentration, then devote yourself to My service, do all yours acts for My sake, and you shall still attain the goal.

Eknath Easwaran: If you are unable to do even this, surrender yourself to   me, disciplining yourself and renouncing the results of all your actions.
Mahatma Gandhi: If you are unable even to do this, then dedicating all to Me, with mind  controlled, abandon the fruit of action.
Shri Swami Purohit: And if you are too weak even for this, then seek refuge in union with Me, and with perfect self-control renounce the fruit of your action.

Eknath Easwaran: Better indeed is knowledge than mechanical practice. Better than knowledge is meditation. But better still is surrender of attachment to results, because there follows immediate peace.
Mahatma Gandhi: Better is knowledge than practice, better than knowledge is concentration,  better than concentration is renunciation of the fruit of all action, from which  directly issues peace.
Shri Swami Purohit: Knowledge is superior to blind action, meditation to mere knowledge, renunciation of the fruit of action to meditation, and where there is renunciation peace will follow.

Eknath Easwaran: That one I love who is incapable of ill will, who is friendly and compassionate. Living beyond the reach of I and mine and of pleasure and pain,
Mahatma Gandhi: Who has ill-will towards none, who is friendly and compassionate, who has  shed all thought of ‘mine' or ‘I', who regards pain and pleasure alike, who is  long-suffering;
Shri Swami Purohit: He who is incapable of hatred towards any being, who is kind and compassionate, free from selfishness, without pride, equable in pleasure and in pain, and forgiving,

Eknath Easwaran: patient, contented, self-controlled, firm in faith, with all their heart and all their mind given to me  with such as these I am in love.
Mahatma Gandhi: Who is ever content, gifted with yoga, self-restrained, of firm conviction,  who has dedicated his mind and reason to Me—that devotee (bhakta) of Mine  is dear to Me.
Shri Swami Purohit: Always contented, self-centred, self-controlled, resolute, with mind and reason dedicated to Me, such a devotee of Mine is My beloved.

Eknath Easwaran: Not agitating the world or by it agitated, they stand above the sway of elation, competition, and fear: that one is my beloved.
Mahatma Gandhi: Who gives no trouble to the world, to whom the world causes no trouble,  who is free from exultation, resentment, fear and vexation,—that man is dear to  Me.
Shri Swami Purohit: He who does not harm the world, and whom the world cannot harm, who is not carried away by any impulse of joy, anger or fear, such a one is My beloved.

Eknath Easwaran: They are detached, pure, efficient, impartial, never anxious, selfless in all their undertakings; they are my devotees, very dear to me.
Mahatma Gandhi: Who expects nothing, who is pure, resourceful, unconcerned, untroubled,  who indulges in no undertakings,—that devotee of Mine is dear to Me.
Shri Swami Purohit: He who expects nothing, who is pure, watchful, indifferent, unruffled, and who renounces all initiative, such a one is My beloved.

Eknath Easwaran: That one is dear to me who runs not after the pleasant or away from the painful, grieves not, lusts not, but lets things come and go as they happen.
Mahatma Gandhi: Who rejoices not, neither frets nor grieves, who covets not, who abandons  both good and ill—that devotee of Mine is dear to Me.
Shri Swami Purohit: He who is beyond joy and hate, who neither laments nor desires, to whom good and evil fortunes are the same, such a one is My beloved.

Eknath Easwaran: That devotee who looks upon friend and foe with equal regard, who is not buoyed up by praise nor cast down by blame, alike in heat and cold, pleasure and pain, free from selfish attachments,
Mahatma Gandhi: Who is same to foe and friend, who regards alike respect and disrespect,  cold and heat, pleasure and pain, who is free from attachment;
Shri Swami Purohit: He to whom friend and foe are alike, who welcomes equally honour and dishonour, heat and cold, pleasure and pain, who is enamoured of nothing,

Eknath Easwaran: the same in honor and dishonor, quiet, ever full, in harmony everywhere, firm in faith  such a one is dear to me.
Mahatma Gandhi: Who weighs in equal scale blame and praise, who is silent, content with  whatever his lot, who owns no home, who is of steady mind,—that devotee of  Mine is dear to Me.
Shri Swami Purohit: Who is indifferent to praise and censure, who enjoys silence, who is contented with every fate, who has no fixed abode, who is steadfast in mind, and filled with devotion, such a one is My beloved.

Eknath Easwaran: Those who meditate upon this immortal dharma as I have declared it, full of faith and seeking me as lifes supreme goal, are truly my devotees, and my love for them is very great.
Mahatma Gandhi: They who follow this essence of dharma, as I have told it, with faith,  keeping Me as their goal,—those devotees are exceeding dear to Me.
Shri Swami Purohit: Verily those who love the spiritual wisdom as I have taught, whose faith never fails, and who concentrate their whole nature on Me, they indeed are My most beloved.”

Eknath Easwaran: KRISHNA  Sages speak of the immutable ashvattha tree, with its taproot above and its branches below. On this tree grow the scriptures; seeing their source, one knows their essence.
Mahatma Gandhi: With the root above and branches below, the ashvattha tree, they say, is  impossible; it has Vedic hymns for its leaves; he who knows it knows the Vedas.
Shri Swami Purohit: “Lord Shri Krishna continued: This phenomenal creation, which is both ephemeral and eternal, is like a tree, but having its seed above in the Highest and its ramifications on this earth below. The scriptures are its leaves, and he who understands this, knows.

Eknath Easwaran: Nourished by the gunas, the limbs of this tree spread above and below. Sense objects grow on the limbs as buds; the roots hanging down bind us to action in this world.
Mahatma Gandhi: Above all and below its branches spread, blossoming because of the gunas,  having for their shoots the sense-objects; deep down in the world of men are  ramified its roots, in the shape of the consequences of action.
Shri Swami Purohit: Its branches shoot upwards and downwards, deriving their nourishment from the Qualities; its buds are the objects of sense; and its roots, which follow the Law causing man’s regeneration and degeneration, pierce downwards into the soil.

Eknath Easwaran: The true form of this tree  its essence, beginning, and end  is not perceived on this earth. Cut down this strong-rooted tree with the sharp axe of detachment;
Mahatma Gandhi: Its form as such is not here perceived, neither is its end, nor beginning, nor  basis. Let man first hew down this deep-rooted Ashvattha with the sure  weapon of detachment;
Shri Swami Purohit: In this world its true form is not known, neither its origin nor its end, and its strength is not understood., until the tree with its roots striking deep into the earth is hewn down by the sharp axe of non-attachment.

Eknath Easwaran: then find the path which does not come back again. Seek That, the First Cause, from which the universe came long ago.
Mahatma Gandhi: Let him pray to win to that haven from which there is no return and seek to  find refuge in the primal Being from whom has emanated this ancient world of  action.
Shri Swami Purohit: Beyond lies the Path, from which, when found, there is no return. This is the Primal God from where this ancient creation has sprung.

Eknath Easwaran: Not deluded by pride, free from selfish attachment and selfish desire, beyond the duality of pleasure and pain, ever aware of the Self, the wise go forward to that eternal goal.
Mahatma Gandhi: To that imperishable haven those enlightened souls go—who are without  pride and delusion, who have triumphed over the taints of attachment, who are  ever in tune with the Supreme, whose passions have died, who are exempt  from the pairs of opposites, such as pleasure and pain.
Shri Swami Purohit: The wise attain Eternity when, freed from pride and delusion, they have conquered their love for the things of sense; when, renouncing desire and fixing their gaze on the Self, they have ceased to be tossed to and fro by the opposing sensations, like pleasure and pain.

Eknath Easwaran: Neither the sun nor the moon nor fire can add to that light. This is my supreme abode, and those who enter there do not return to separate existence.
Mahatma Gandhi: Neither the sun, nor the moon, nor fire illumine it; men who arrive there  return not—that is My supreme abode.
Shri Swami Purohit: Neither sun, moon, nor fire shines there. Those who go towards that place never come back. For, O Arjuna, that is my Celestial Home!

Eknath Easwaran: An eternal part of me enters into the world, assuming the powers of action and perception and a mind made of prakriti.
Mahatma Gandhi: As part indeed of Myself which has been the eternal Jiva(the Vital Essence) in this world of life,  attracts the mind and the five senses from their place in prakriti.
Shri Swami Purohit: It is only a very small part of My Eternal Self, which is the life of the universe, drawing round itself the six senses, the mind the last, which have their source in Nature.

Eknath Easwaran: When the divine Self enters and leaves a body, it takes these along as the wind carries a scent from place to place.
Mahatma Gandhi: When the master (of the body) acquires a body and discards it he carries  these with him wherever he goes, even as the wind carries scents from flower  beds.
Shri Swami Purohit: When the Supreme Lord enters a body or leaves it, He gathers these senses together and travels on with them, as the wind gathers perfume while passing through the flowers.

Eknath Easwaran: Using the mind, ears, eyes, nose, and the senses of taste and touch, the Self enjoys sense objects.
Mahatma Gandhi: Having settled himself in the senses—ear, eye, touch, taste, and smell—as  well as the mind, through them he frequents their objects.
Shri Swami Purohit: He is the perception of the ear, the eye, the touch, the taste and the smell, yea and of the mind also; and the enjoyment the things which they perceive is also His.

Eknath Easwaran: The deluded do not see the Self when it leaves the body or when it dwells within it. They do not see the Self enjoying sense objects or acting through the gunas. But they who have the eye of wisdom see.
Mahatma Gandhi: The deluded perceive Him not as He leaves or settles in (a body) or enjoys  (sense objects) in association with the gunas; it is those endowed with the eye of  knowledge who alone see Him.
Shri Swami Purohit: The ignorant do not see that it is He Who is present in life and Who departs at death or even that it is He Who enjoys pleasure through the Qualities. Only the eye of wisdom sees.

Eknath Easwaran: Those who strive resolutely on the path of yoga see the Self within. The thoughtless, who strive imperfectly, do not.
Mahatma Gandhi: Yogins who strive see Him seated in themselves; the witless ones who have  not cleansed themselves to see Him not, even though they strive.
Shri Swami Purohit: The saints with great effort find Him within themselves; but not the unintelligent, who in spite of every effort cannot control their minds.

Eknath Easwaran: The brightness of the sun, which lights up the world, the brightness of the moon and of fire  these are my glory.
Mahatma Gandhi: The light in the sun which illumines the whole universe and which is in the  moon and in fire—that light, know you, is Mine;
Shri Swami Purohit: Remember that the Light which, proceeding from the sun, illumines the whole world, and the Light which is in the moon, and That which is in the fire also, all are born of Me.

Eknath Easwaran: With a drop of my energy I enter the earth and support all creatures. Through the moon, the vessel of life-giving fluid, I nourish all plants.
Mahatma Gandhi: It is I, who penetrating the earth uphold all beings with My strength, and  becoming the moon—the essence of all sap—nourish all the herbs;
Shri Swami Purohit: I enter this world and animate all My creatures with My vitality; and by My cool moonbeams I nourish the plants.

Eknath Easwaran: I enter breathing creatures and dwell within as the lifegiving breath. I am the fire in the stomach which digests all food.
Mahatma Gandhi: It is I who becoming the Vaishvanara Fire and entering the bodies of all that  breathe, assimilate the four kinds of food with the help of the outward and the  inward breaths.
Shri Swami Purohit: Becoming the fire of life, I pass into their bodies and, uniting with the vital streams of Prana and Apana, I digest the various kinds of food.

Eknath Easwaran: Entering into every heart, I give the power to remember and understand; it is I again who take that power away. All the scriptures lead to me; I am their author and their wisdom.
Mahatma Gandhi: And I am seated in the hearts of all, from Me proceed memory, knowledge  and the dispelling of doubts; it is I who am to be known in all the Vedas, I, the  author of Vedanta and the knower of the Vedas.
Shri Swami Purohit: I am enthroned in the hearts of all; memory, wisdom and discrimination owe their origins to Me. I am He Who is to be realised in the scriptures; I inspire their wisdom and I know their truth.

Eknath Easwaran: In this world there are two orders of being: the perishable, separate creature and the changeless spirit.
Mahatma Gandhi: There are two Beings in the world: perishable (perishable) and imperishable  (imperishable). Perishable embraces all creatures and their permanent basis is  imperishable.
Shri Swami Purohit: There are two aspects in Nature: the perishable and the imperishable. All life in this world belongs to the former, the unchanging element belongs to the latter.

Eknath Easwaran: But beyond these there is another, the supreme Self, the eternal Lord, who enters into the entire cosmos and supports it from within.
Mahatma Gandhi: The Supreme Being is surely another—called eternal Soul who is the  Imperishable Supreme Being pervades and supports the three worlds.
Shri Swami Purohit: But higher than all am I, the Supreme God, the Absolute Self, the Eternal Lord, Who pervades the worlds and upholds them all.

Eknath Easwaran: I am that supreme Self, praised by the scriptures as beyond the changing and the changeless.
Mahatma Gandhi: Because I transcend the perishable and am also higher than the imperishable, I am  known in the world and in the Vedas as Krishna (the Highest Being).
Shri Swami Purohit: Beyond comparison of the Eternal with the non-eternal am I, Who am called by scriptures and sages the Supreme Personality, the Highest God.

Eknath Easwaran: Those who see in me that supreme Self see truly. They have found the source of all wisdom, Arjuna, and they worship me with all their heart.
Mahatma Gandhi: He who, undeluded, knows Me as Krishna, knows all, he worships  Me with all his heart, O Arjuna.
Shri Swami Purohit: He who with unclouded vision sees Me as the Lord-God, knows all there is to be known, and always shall worship Me with his whole heart.

Eknath Easwaran: I have shared this profound truth with you, Arjuna. Those who understand it will attain wisdom; they will have done that which has to be done.
Mahatma Gandhi: Thus I have revealed to you, sinless one, this most mysterious shastra; he  who understands this, O Arjuna, is a man of understanding, he has fulfilled his  life's mission.
Shri Swami Purohit: Thus, O Sinless One, I have revealed to you this most mystic knowledge. He who understands gains wisdom and attains the consummation of life.”

Eknath Easwaran: KRISHNA:  Be fearless and pure; never waver in your determination or your dedication to the spiritual life. Give freely. Be self-controlled, sincere, truthful, loving, and full of the desire to serve. Realize the truth of the scriptures; learn to be detached and to take joy in renunciation.
Mahatma Gandhi: Fearlessness, purity of heart, steadfastness in jnana and yoga—knowledge  and action, beneficence, self-restraint, sacrifice, spiritual study, austerity, and  uprightness;
Shri Swami Purohit: “Lord Shri Krishna continued: Fearlessness, clean living, unceasing concentration on wisdom, readiness to give, self-control, a spirit of sacrifice, regular study of the scriptures, austerities, candour,

Eknath Easwaran: Do not get angry or harm any living creature, but be compassionate and gentle; show good will to all.
Mahatma Gandhi: Non-violence, truth, slowness to wrath, the spirit of dedication, serenity,  aversion to slander, tenderness to all that lives, freedom from greed, gentleness,  modesty, freedom from levity;
Shri Swami Purohit: harmlessness, truth, absence of wrath, renunciation, contentment, straightforwardness, compassion towards all, uncovetousness, courtesy, modesty, constancy,

Eknath Easwaran: Cultivate vigor, patience, will, purity; avoid malice and pride. Then, Arjuna, you will achieve your divine destiny.
Mahatma Gandhi: Spiritedness, forgiveness, fortitude, purity, freedom from ill-will and  arrogance—these are to be found in one born with the divine heritage, O  Arjuna.
Shri Swami Purohit: Valour, forgiveness, fortitude, purity, freedom from hate and vanity; these are his who possesses the Godly Qualities, O Arjuna!

Eknath Easwaran: Other qualities, Arjuna, make a person more and more inhuman: hypocrisy, arrogance, conceit, anger, cruelty, ignorance.
Mahatma Gandhi: Pretentiousness, arrogance, self-conceit, wrath, coarseness, ignorance—these  are to be found in one born with the devilish heritage.
Shri Swami Purohit: Hypocrisy, pride, insolence, cruelty, ignorance belong to him who is born of the godless qualities.

Eknath Easwaran: The divine qualities lead to freedom; the demonic, to bondage. But do not grieve, Arjuna; you were born with divine attributes.
Mahatma Gandhi: The divine heritage makes for Freedom, the devilish for bondage. Grieve not,  O Arjuna; you are born with a divine heritage.
Shri Swami Purohit: Godly qualities lead to liberation; godless to bondage. Do not be anxious, Prince! You have the Godly qualities.

Eknath Easwaran: Some people have divine tendencies, others demonic. I have described the divine at length, Arjuna; now listen while I describe the demonic.
Mahatma Gandhi: There are two orders of created beings in this world—the divine and the  devilish; the divine order has been described in detail, hear from Me now of the  devilish, O Arjuna.
Shri Swami Purohit: All beings are of two classes: Godly and godless. The Godly I have described; I will now describe the other.

Eknath Easwaran: The demonic do things they should avoid and avoid the things they should do. They have no sense of uprightness, purity, or truth.
Mahatma Gandhi: Men of the devil do not know what they may do and what they may not do;  neither is there any purity, nor right conduct, nor truth to be found in them.
Shri Swami Purohit: The godless do not know how to act or how to renounce. They have neither purity nor truth. They do not understand the right principles of conduct.

Eknath Easwaran: There is no God, they say, no truth, no spiritual law, no moral order. The basis of life is sex; what else can it be?
Mahatma Gandhi: ‘Without truth, without basis, without God is the universe,' they say; ‘born of  the union of the sexes, prompted by nothing but lust.'
Shri Swami Purohit: They say the universe is an accident with no purpose and no God. Life is created by sexual union, a product of lust and nothing else.

Eknath Easwaran: Holding such distorted views, possessing scant discrimination, they become enemies of the world, causing suffering and destruction.
Mahatma Gandhi: Holding this view, these depraved souls, of feeble understanding and of  fierce deeds, come forth as enemies of the world to destroy it.
Shri Swami Purohit: Thinking thus, these degraded souls, these enemies of mankind – whose intelligence is negligible and whose deeds are monstrous – come into the world only to destroy.

Eknath Easwaran: Hypocritical, proud, and arrogant, living in delusion and clinging to deluded ideas, insatiable in their desires, they pursue their unclean ends.
Mahatma Gandhi: Given to insatiable lust, possessed by pretentiousness, arrogance and  conceit, they seize wicked purposes in their delusion, and go about pledged to  uncleaned deeds.
Shri Swami Purohit: Giving themselves up to insatiable passions, hypocritical, self-sufficient and arrogant, cherishing false conception founded on delusion, they work only to carry out their own unholy purposes.

Eknath Easwaran: Although burdened with fears that end only with death, they still maintain with complete assurance, Gratification of lust is the highest that life can offer.
Mahatma Gandhi: Given to boundless cares that end only with their death, making indulgence  or lust their sole goal, convinced that that is all;
Shri Swami Purohit: Poring anxiously over evil resolutions, which only end in death; seeking only the gratification of desire as the highest goal; seeing nothing beyond;

Eknath Easwaran: Bound on all sides by scheming and anxiety, driven by anger and greed, they amass by any means they can a hoard of money for the satisfaction of their cravings.
Mahatma Gandhi: Caught in a myriad snares of hope, slaves to lust and wrath, they speak  unlawfully to amass wealth for the satisfaction of their appetites.
Shri Swami Purohit: Caught in the toils of a hundred vain hopes, the slaves of passion and wrath, they accumulate hoards of unjust wealth, only to pander to their sensual desire.

Eknath Easwaran: I got this today, they say; tomorrow I shall get that. This wealth is mine, and that will be mine too.
Mahatma Gandhi: ‘This have I gained today; this aspiration shall I now attain; this wealth is  mine; this likewise shall be mine hereafter;
Shri Swami Purohit: This I have gained today; tomorrow I will gratify another desire; this wealth is mine now, the rest shall be mine before long;

Eknath Easwaran: I have destroyed my enemies. I shall destroy others too! Am I not like God? I enjoy what I want. I am successful. I am powerful. I am happy.
Mahatma Gandhi: ‘This enemy I have already slain, others also I shall slay; lord of all am I;  enjoyment is mine, perfection is mine, strength is mine, happiness is mine;
Shri Swami Purohit: I have slain one enemy, I will slay the others also; I am worthy to enjoy, I am the Almighty, I am perfect, powerful and happy;

Eknath Easwaran: I am rich and well-born. Who is equal to me? I will perform sacrifices and give gifts, and rejoice in my own generosity. This is how they go on, deluded by ignorance.
Mahatma Gandhi: ‘Wealthy am I, and high-born. What other is like unto me? I shall perform a  sacrifice! I shall give alms! I shall be merry!' Thus think they, by ignorance  deluded;
Shri Swami Purohit: I am rich, I am well-bred; who is there to compare with me? I will sacrifice, I will give, I will pay – and I will enjoy. Thus blinded by Ignorance,

Eknath Easwaran: Bound by their greed and entangled in a web of delusion, whirled about by a fragmented mind, they fall into a dark hell.
Mahatma Gandhi: And tossed about by diverse fancies, caught in the net of delusion, stuck  deep in the indulgence of appetites, into foul hell they fall.
Shri Swami Purohit: Perplexed by discordant thoughts, entangled in the snares of desire, infatuated by passion, they sink into the horrors of hell.

Eknath Easwaran: Self-important, obstinate, swept away by the pride of wealth, they ostentatiously perform sacrifices without any regard for their purpose.
Mahatma Gandhi: Wise in their own conceit, stubborn, full of the intoxication of pelf and pride,  they offer nominal sacrifices for show, contrary to the rule.
Shri Swami Purohit: Self-conceited, stubborn, rich, proud and insolent, they make a display of their patronage, disregarding the rules of decency.

Eknath Easwaran: Egotistical, violent, arrogant, lustful, angry, envious of everyone, they abuse my presence within their own bodies and in the bodies of others.
Mahatma Gandhi: Given to pride, force, arrogance, lust and wrath they are deriders indeed,  scorning Me in their own and other' bodies.
Shri Swami Purohit: Puffed up by power and inordinate conceit, swayed by lust and wrath, these wicked people hate Me Who am within them, as I am within all.

Eknath Easwaran: Life after life I cast those who are malicious, hateful, cruel, and degraded into the wombs of those with similar demonic natures.
Mahatma Gandhi: These cruel scorners, lowest of mankind and vile, I hurl down again and  again, into devilish wombs.
Shri Swami Purohit: Those who thus hate Me, who are cruel, the dregs of mankind, I condemn them to a continuous, miserable and godless rebirth.

Eknath Easwaran: Birth after birth they find themselves with demonic tendencies. Degraded in this way, Arjuna, they fail to reach me and fall lower still.
Mahatma Gandhi: Doomed to devilish wombs, these deluded ones, far from ever coming to  Me, sink lower and lower in birth after birth.
Shri Swami Purohit: So reborn, they spend life after life, enveloped in delusion. And they never reach Me, O Prince, but degenerate into still lower forms of life.

Eknath Easwaran: There are three gates to this self-destructive hell: lust, anger, and greed. Renounce these three.
Mahatma Gandhi: Three-fold is the gate of hell, leading man to perdition—Lust, Wrath, and  Greed; these three, therefore, should be shunned.
Shri Swami Purohit: The gates of hell are three: lust, wrath and avarice. They destroy the Self. Avoid them.

Eknath Easwaran: Those who escape from these three gates of darkness, Arjuna, seek what is best and attain lifes supreme goal.
Mahatma Gandhi: The man who escapes these three gates of Darkness, O Arjuna, works out  his welfare and from there reaches the highest state.
Shri Swami Purohit: These are the gates which lead to darkness; if a man avoid them he will ensure his own welfare, and in the end will attain his liberation.

Eknath Easwaran: Others disregard the teachings of the scriptures. Driven by selfish desire, they miss the goal of life, miss even happiness and success.
Mahatma Gandhi: He who forsakes the rule of shastra and does but the bidding of his selfish  desires, gains neither perfection, nor happiness, nor the highest state.
